page.title: 17WOODINGDEAN COMMUNITY CENTRE
page.content: During the summer the Community Centre is used by foreign students as a study base.They come to Brighton for 2 or 3 weeks to learn English whilst on holiday.Many of them live with host families in Woodingdean.The Community Centre is on a site which includes a school,library,youth club and swimming pool.This enables services to be used at the same time.A mother can go to keep fit class at the centre whilst her children are at school.The children can go swimming when she is at the library or a coffee morning at the centre.There are family events at the centre such as discos or barbecues.On the opposite side of the road there is a parade of shops and there is free car parking.
